moves.1. e4 c5:
in the past couple of months I'm trying to adapt myself to the Sicilian.
Not sure if I know the basic principles yet but lets play
moves.2. Nc3: Nf3 is more usual, but this is ok to put pieces at play
moves.2... Nc6 3. f4:
white trying to dominate the center
not very usual but interesting
moves.3... g6:
one of the problems I'm facing with the Sicilian is that B in f8
the best way to put it to play is Bg7
moves.5... e6:
taking pressure away from Ng5, threatening xf7
problem: the B in c8

not sure if d6 is better...
moves.6. O-O Nge7:
preparing the castle.
allows f5 latter and let's Bg7 have a more important role in this part of the game
moves.7. a3:
I don't see why this was played.

preparing b4?
preventing the pinning of the N?

if some of the comments just could help me on this one
moves.8. d3 d5: fighting for the center and giving space for the pieces
moves.9. exd5:
I wouldn't have done this.
the king is poorly protected and the B is about to stay out of the game ... forever
moves.10. Ba2 a6:
don't want the N to come to b5.
another piece with limited action
moves.11... Bg4: pinning the N and bringing the B to play
moves.12. Qe1:
Unpinning and taking care of the e column.
 
The Q is squeezing the R and the K, not allowing them to breed. that will be a problem!

of course Re1 is possible
moves.12... Nd4:
building up pressure near the K
if the N isn't taken I was up to Nxc2
moves.13. Nxd4:
was this the best option? or the only option?
probably Kg2, but then Qd7 and Bg3
moves.15. Ne2:
understandable.
now white must diminish the pressure, probably hopping for Bxe2?
moves.15... Nf5: protecting Bd4 and increasing the options near the white K
moves.16. c3 Be3: if Bxe3, Nxe3; Rf2, Nc2 and Ra1 is gone
moves.17. Bb1: protecting c2 so that BxB is possible
moves.18... Nxe3: if dxe3 I would have a passed pawn with limited possibilities and white would play d4 and the B would come to play
moves.19... Rfe8:
This was fundamental to defend the very important Ne3.
thinking in doubling R's or Qd5?

opening: Sicilian (B23), Grand Prix attack, Schofman variation
